title: Mel Rodriguez
text:
Melvin Dimas Rodríguez (born June 12, 1973) is an American actor, best known for starring as Nurse Patsy de la Serda on the <a href="HBO">HBO</a> comedy "<a href="Getting%20On%20%28American%20TV%20series%29">Getting On</a>", as Todd Rodriguez on the <a href="Fox%20Broadcasting%20Company">Fox</a> comedy "<a href="The%20Last%20Man%20on%20Earth%20%28TV%20series%29">The Last Man on Earth</a>", and as Ernie Gomes on the <a href="Showtime%20%28TV%20network%29">Showtime</a> drama "<a href="On%20Becoming%20a%20God%20in%20Central%20Florida">On Becoming a God in Central Florida</a>". Other notable works include recurring as <a href="Marco%20%28Better%20Call%20Saul%29">Marco Pasternak</a> on <a href="AMC%20%28TV%20channel%29">AMC</a>'s "<a href="Better%20Call%20Saul">Better Call Saul</a>" and co-starring on the short-lived Fox sitcoms "<a href="Running%20Wilde">Running Wilde</a>" and "<a href="Enlisted%20%28TV%20series%29">Enlisted</a>". In 2021, Rodriguez will appear in the crime television series "".
Life and career.
Rodríguez was born in Miami, Florida, and grew up in its <a href="Little%20Havana">Little Havana</a> neighborhood. He first pursued a career in boxing, until he was led onto the path of acting by his high school teacher at age 17, first starring in an AIDS awareness play entitled "The Inner Circle" with <a href="Pedro%20Zamora">Pedro Zamora</a>. He dropped out of high school and managed to receive a scholarship, which he used to graduate from <a href="State%20University%20of%20New%20York%20at%20Purchase">SUNY Purchase</a>. After his graduation, Rodríguez stayed in <a href="Purchase%2C%20New%20York">Purchase</a> and managed a cigar shop, from time to time visiting <a href="New%20York%20City">New York City</a> to act on stage. He did his first role on screen in 1999 in an episode of the legal drama television series "<a href="Law%20%26amp%3B%20Order">Law & Order</a>", which was filming in the state. Rodríguez then moved to <a href="Los%20Angeles">Los Angeles</a>, focusing more on his career in the film industry and less on his acting on stage. His first role in a full-length feature film was in the 1999 comedy "Wirey Spindell". He achieved his breakthrough by scoring the recurring role of Frank on the ABC comedy series "<a href="George%20Lopez%20%28TV%20series%29">George Lopez</a>" in 2002.
Rodríguez is most known for his recurring roles as Sgt. Núñez on "<a href="Community%20%28TV%20series%29">Community</a>" and SPC Chubowski on the <a href="Fox%20Broadcasting%20Company">Fox</a> sitcom "<a href="Enlisted%20%28TV%20series%29">Enlisted</a>". He portrayed Marco Pasternak, the best friend and partner-in-crime of <a href="Saul%20Goodman">Jimmy McGill</a> in the first and third seasons of "<a href="Better%20Call%20Saul">Better Call Saul</a>". He had a brief role as Officer Morales in the 2002 film "<a href="Panic%20Room">Panic Room</a>", and was a regular on "<a href="The%20Last%20Man%20on%20Earth%20%28TV%20series%29">The Last Man on Earth</a>" (2015). He also appeared as Officer Martinez in "<a href="Little%20Miss%20Sunshine">Little Miss Sunshine</a>" (2006).
Rodriguez decided to depart "" after its first season as Medical Examiner Hugo Ramirez.
